data.title: Brenda Barrett (Vanessa Marcil)
data.meta_description: Brenda Veronica Barrett is a fictional character on the ABC soap opera General Hospital. She is the mother of Alec Barrett with the late mobster Aleksander Janáček. The role was originated in 1992 by Vanessa Marcil. Brenda was on-screen from 1992-98 and made three returns in 2002, 2010 and 2013...
data.text:
This page uses Creative Commons Licensed content from Wikipedia (view authors).

Brenda Veronica Barrett is a fictional character on the ABC soap opera General Hospital. She is the mother of Alec Barrett with the late mobster Aleksander Janáček.

The role was originated in 1992 by Vanessa Marcil. Brenda was on-screen from 1992-98 and made three returns in 2002, 2010 and 2013.

Casting[]

Actress Vanessa Marcil premiered in the role of Brenda on General Hospital in September 1992. She remained with the series for six years before departing in September 1998. In May 2002, it was announced that Marcil would return to the series as Brenda Barrett.[4] Her return, however, was cut short when in January 2003 it was announced that Marcil was leaving the series once again, this time over contract disputes.[5]

In an interview with TV Guide, Marcil stated:

When I signed a short-term deal last summer, I made it clear I'd have to see how my son responded to my going back to work. And he hasn't responded well. I'm really disappointed to be leaving, but I guess ABC's not willing to compromise on the things I need. I have a lot more needs now that I have a child, and they need what they need to run a show smoothly.

Marcil's last airdate aired on February 19, 2003. In the next few years following her exit, rumors continued to appear concerning Marcil's return on the Internet, with nothing of truth coming to them. During her stint on the NBC series Las Vegas, Internet rumors began to heat up over a possible reprival of Brenda Barrett. However, following another season pick up in 2007, Marcil's reps said that she could not reprise, due to be contractually obligated to the NBC series. Fan rumors persisted, with speculation of a possible recast in talks on Internet message boards. Such actresses as Gina Tognoni (Dinah Marler, GL; Kelly Cramer, OLTL) and Rebecca Budig (Greenlee Smythe, AMC) were rumored to be up for a recast however no truth came to such rumors.

In early 2008, then-executive producer Robert Guza, Jr. confirmed to Soap Opera Digest that he was in close talks with Marcil to reprise her role of Brenda. Guza stated:[6] I'm in very close contact with [Vanessa]. She wants to make it happen. I would do handstands to make it happen. Fans were disappointed once again in 2008, when following the cancellation of Las Vegas, Marcil landed two primetime acting jobs; a role on the NBC series Lipstick Jungle and as a host on the reality series Blush: The Search for the Next Great Make-Up Artist on Lifetime.[6]

In January 2009, Marcil told her fans that she was trying to make a return to General Hospital work. In a statement to Soap Opera Digest, she stated:[7] We're trying to make it work again. We were trying to fit it in this past year, but it didn't work out, so maybe in '09 we'll find a way. However, a mere two weeks later, such "talks" were muted when Marcil landed the recurring role as Kim Marcus on the CBS primetime series Without a Trace. She premiered in the role on March 17, 2009.[8] In early January 2010, the series confirmed they were back in-talks with Marcil to reprise the role of Brenda Barrett. Guza commented:[9] We have actually been in contact with Vanessa, and there is interest on both parts in seeing Brenda return.

Three months later, rumors began heating up that Marcil was closer than ever towards a return to Port Charles and Brenda Barrett.[10] On June 7, 2010, after seven years of speculation, ABC announced that Marcil had signed a one-year contract with the series to reprise the role of Brenda Barrett on General Hospital.[11][12] When asked why she decided to return to the series, Marcil stated:[13]

Because it feels so right. A lot's been going on. We found out that my older sister, Sherry, has breast cancer. We've bought a farm in upstate New York and she and I went up there to spend a week together before she had to start her chemo, and it got me thinking about how grateful I am to GH for giving me pretty much everything I have. [Head writer] Bob Guza and I got back in touch again during that time. I told him I wanted to settle down for a while so that I could be available to my sister and my family, and that maybe during that time I could come in and out at GH for a couple of days a week. I called [ABC Daytime chief] Brian Frons and asked him if he would have me back, and he was gracious enough to say yes. I just couldn't feel any more grateful that I'm still allowed to visit such a great place. I love that Julianne Moore went back to As the World Turns to honor where she came from. It's important to do that. I left GH for a few different reasons, but it was never because I wasn't madly in love with the show and the character and with daytime.

During an interview in February 2011, Marcil revealed she'd entertain signing another one-year contract if it worked with her scheduling and family life.[14] On June 7, 2011, it was announced that Marcil would once again vacate the role of Brenda.[15][16][17] Marcil departed General Hospital again on July 21, 2011.[18]

It was announced on March 5, 2013 that Marcil would once again reprise her role as Brenda for the series' 50 anniversary celebration.[19][20] She returned from April 2 to April 23, 2013.

On January 3, 2021, Marcil hinted on Instagram that she might be returning as Brenda, although an official statement and air-date have not been reported.[21]

Background[]

Brenda Veronica Barrett is born to Harlan Barrett and his former lover, Veronica Wilding on March 31, 1975,[22] the birth celebrated on-screen April 5.[23]

On December 5, 1991, after Harlan died, Bill asked his daughter, Julia Barrett, if there were any other family members who should be notified and Julia mentioned that she had a sister in Europe, but stated that she did not want to talk about it.

In 1992, the 17-year-old drops out of boarding school and turns up on the doorstep of her older sister, Julia. Julia has been blocking Brenda's access to her trust fund until she agrees to finish school. She later moves in with Jagger Cates and clashes with Karen Wexler, who is in love with Jagger. Brenda also becomes best friends with Robin Scorpio.

Storylines[]

Crimes Committed[]

Stole cash and her car from her sister, Julia [Sep 29, 1992]

Took photos of a showering Karen Wexler and distributed them around their high school [Jan 13, 1993]

Forged Karen Wexler's term paper to make it look like she cheated [Mar 18, 1993]

Arrested for shoplifting a dress [June 8, 1993]

Slapped Sonny Corinthos [Jun 14, 1994]

Slapped Sonny [Aug 7, 1995]

Accidentally set fire to Lily's wedding dress [Jan 16, 1996]

Slapped Sonny [Nov 5, 1996]

Posed as Nurse Marilyn Cooper's sister in order to find information on her [Dec 27, 1996]

Arrested for the murder of Dr. Pierce Dorman (not guilty) [Jun 27, 1997; charges dropped]

Escaped from jail when they were holding her for Dr. Pierce Dorman's murder and went on the run with the help of Sonny and Jason [Jun 27, 1997]

Slapped Jason [Sep 22, 1997]

Attacked Jason while he was in a police car [Dec 8, 1997]

Sabotaged her photo shoot while suffering a mental breakdown [Dec 15, 1997]

Threw a glass of water in her mother Veronica's face [Aug 26, 1998]

Stole a flare gun and used it to shoot out a window on Luis Alcazar's yacht so she could escape, causing the yacht to flood [Sep 12, 2002]

Hit Benny Abrahms over the head with a vase and rendered him unconscious [Sep 19, 2002]

Attacked Luis in court [Oct 30, 2002]

Held Luis at gunpoint and fired a shot into the air [Nov 11, 2002]

Broke into Jason's gun case and stole his gun [Nov 14, 2002]

Adultery; slept with Jax numerous times while she was married to Jason Morgan and he was married to Skye Quartermaine [Nov 18, 2002-Feb 12, 2003]

Cut Luis' hand with a knife [Nov 22, 2002]

Shoved Carly Corinthos [Nov 27, 2002]

Fled town to avoid facing charges for murder [Dec 24, 2002]

Found guilty of the murder of Luiz Alcazar (ruling turned over) [Jan 24, 2003]

Shot and killed Aleksander Janáček in defense of Det. Dante Falconeri [2007; revealed in a flashback in 2010]

Hit Dante over the head with a vase and rendered him unconscious [Oct 2010]

Shot and killed Anton Banovic, an employee of The Balkan, in defense of Det. Dante Falconeri [Nov 1, 2010]

Tricked Michael Corinthos into believing they slept together [Apr 2013]

Tricked Carly Jacks into believing she slept with her son, Michael [Apr 2013]

Health and Vitals[]

Slapped by her sister, Julia [Dec 15, 1992]

Slapped by Karen Wexler [Mar 31, 1993]

Car accident when her car collided with Sonny's [Mar 14, 1994]

Gave blood for a blood transfusion for Sonny [Mar 16, 1994]

Kidnapped by men working for Hernando Rivera [Nov 30, 1994; saved by Sonny]

Along with Sonny, Lily, and Miguel, kidnapped by men working for Hernando Rivera and taken to his house [Dec 5, 1994]

Shot at while in the shower by associates of Joe Scully and suffered minor cuts from broken glass [May 12, 1995]

Had her head grabbed and shook and threatened with physical harm by Sonny [Jul 17, 1995]

Knocked unconscious and injured after almost being hit by a car sent by Hernando Rivera [Apr 1, 1996; Lily pushed her out of the way]

Went into cardiac arrest [Apr 1, 1996]

Slapped by Lily [Apr 24, 1996]

Sprained her ankle [Apr 30, 1996]

Trapped in a cabin with Sonny during a snow storm [Apr 30-May 6, 1996]

Addicted to pain killers for a hip injury from almost being run down with a car [July 1996-Mar 1997]

Stalked by Harry Silver [Jan-Feb 1997]

Slapped by Harry [Feb 25, 1997]

Kidnapped by Harry and taken to the catacombs [Feb 25, 1997]

Along with Sonny, had her life threatened by Harry with an explosive device [Feb 27, 1997]

Trapped in a cave with Sonny after Harry Silver detonated a bomb and caused it to collapse [Mar 3-10, 1997]

Forced to drink a substance that made her lose consciousness and kidnapped by the Tin Man on the orders of Hernando Rivera [Aug 4, 1997]

Encountered a Mountain Lion [Aug 7, 1997]

Fell down a hole; rescued by Sonny [Aug 7, 1997]

Held at gunpoint and almost shot by Hernando [Aug 11, 1997]

Suffered a mental breakdown after being left at the alter by Sonny [Dec 1997]

Suffered numerous injuries and temporary amnesia after her mother drove their car off a cliff [Sep 11, 1998]

Presumed dead [Sep 1998-Sep 2002]

Almost drowned when she was locked in a room on Luis Alcazar's yacht that flooded with water [Sep 12-13, 2003]

Kidnapped by Luis and forced onto his private plane where she was handcuffed to her seat [Nov 6, 2002]

In a plane crash when Luis' private plane crashed in the middle of a jungle; lost consciousness [Nov 7, 2002]

Knocked back by the explosion caused by Luis shooting his plane with a flare gun [Nov 12, 2002]

Held in a chokehold and had a flare gun pointed at her by Luis [Nov 12, 2002]

Stuck in quicksand; rescued by Jason Morgan [Nov 12-13, 2002]

Framed for Luis' murder by A.J. Quartermaine, Skye Quartermaine, and Coleman Ratcliffe [Dec 2002]

Jumped into freezing cold water on the pier to locate a sunken key to Luis' safe deposit box and nearly drowned; saved by Nikolas Cassadine [Jan 16, 2003]

Fainting spell [2007]

Drugged by Suzanne Stanwyck, which caused her to have a fever and to lose consciousness [2007; revealed 2010]

Gave birth to her son completely natural [2007]

Suffered minor injuries during attempted kidnapping [Aug 2010]

Given an overdose of heroin [Sep 2010]

Drugged and kidnapped on her wedding day by Theo Hoffman [Feb 2011]

Injected with a deadly neurotoxin by Theo Hoffman [Mar 2011]

Trivia[]

Brenda‘s astrological sign is Aries
